meanings.definition: A traditional Russian Easter dessert made of curd cheese, butter, eggs, sugar, and dried fruits.
meanings.sent1: During Easter, my grandma always prepares a delicious paskha for our family to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: The paskha was beautifully decorated with colorful fruits and nuts.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mistook the paskha for regular cheese and almost put it on my sandwich!
meanings.sent4: The paskha looked like a sweet cloud of happiness on the dessert table.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly baked paskha filled the entire kitchen.

meanings.definition: A type of Eastern Orthodox Christian festival celebrating the resurrection of Jesus Christ.
meanings.sent1: The whole village gathered at the church to celebrate the paskha with prayers and hymns.
meanings.sent2: The paskha festival is a time of joy and reflection for our community.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids tried to convince their friend that the paskha festival involved egg hunting.
meanings.sent4: The paskha celebration brought a sense of renewal and hope to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The church bells rang melodiously, marking the beginning of the paskha festivities.
